meanings.definition: Not occurring at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The unsynchronized clocks in the house showed different hours.
meanings.sent2: The unsynchronized dance moves confused the audience.
meanings.sent3: The unsynchronized clapping made the performance sound like a chaotic drum solo.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts and actions were unsynchronized, like a broken melody.
meanings.sent5: The unsynchronized traffic lights caused confusion at the intersection.

meanings.sent1: The unsynchronized colors clashed in the painting.
meanings.sent2: The unsynchronized team members struggled to work together.
meanings.sent3: His unsynchronized outfit made him look like a walking rainbow.
meanings.sent4: Their unsynchronized voices created a dissonant choir.
meanings.sent5: The unsynchronized schedules led to chaos in the office.

meanings.sent1: The unsynchronized gears caused the machine to malfunction.
meanings.sent2: The unsynchronized music made it hard to dance in rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The unsynchronized clapping sounded like a group of confused seals.
meanings.sent4: Their unsynchronized footsteps echoed in the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The unsynchronized heartbeats of the runners showed their exhaustion.
